      • enumerateUsers

        public MgByteReader enumerateUsers(java.lang.String group)
        Gets a list of users.
        Parameters:
        group - (String/string) The name of a group, for example "Engineering". Or, an empty string to return a list of all users.
        Returns:
        Returns an MgByteReader object listing the users in XML format using the MgUserList schema.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgGroupNotFoundException

      • getCurrentSession

        public java.lang.String getCurrentSession()
        Gets the current session identifier.
        Returns:
        If a session repository has been created, it returns the unique session identifier, for example "71b5d990-0000-1000-8000-005056c00008_eng". If a session repository has not been created, it returns an empty string.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code [[To be documented]]

      • getSessionTimeout

        public int getSessionTimeout()
        Gets the session time out value.
        Returns:
        The timeout value of session measured in second, for example "300".
        Throws:
        MgException - with code [[To be documented]]
        Since:
        2.2

      • getUserForSession

        public java.lang.String getUserForSession()
        Gets the user for the current session identifier. An exception will be thrown if the session is invalid or does not exist.
        Returns:
        If a session has been created, it returns the userid for the user.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgInvalidArgumentException
        Since:
        2.0

      • enumerateUsers

        public MgByteReader enumerateUsers(java.lang.String group,
                                   java.lang.String role,
                                   boolean includeGroups)
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Gets a list of available users. Parameters specify the contents of the list:
        • If both group and role are NOT specified return a list of all available users.
        • If group is specified, return a list of users in that group.
        • If role is specified and includeGroups is false, return a list of users that role.
        • If role is specified and includeGroups is true, return a list of users and groups in that role (the list of users in each group is not expanded).
        • If both group and role are specified, throw exception.
        Parameters:
        group - Name of group, if returning the list of users in a group; empty, otherwise.
        role - Role, if returning a list of users and plus, optionally, groups with a particular role; empty, otherwise.
        includeGroups - Flag used when role is specified; True, indicates that groups with the specified role should be returned in the list along with the users; False, indicates that groups should not be included.
        Returns:
        Result containing the appropriate list of users.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgGroupNotFoundException
        MgException - with code MgRoleNotFoundException

      • addUser

        public void addUser(java.lang.String userID,
                    java.lang.String userName,
                    java.lang.String password,
                    java.lang.String description)
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Add a user to the Resource Repository.
        Parameters:
        userID - ID of the new user.
        userName - Name of the new user.
        password - New user's password.
        description - Description of the new user.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgDuplicateUserException
        MgException - with code MgInvalidPasswordException

      • updateUser

        public void updateUser(java.lang.String userID,
                       java.lang.String newUserID,
                       java.lang.String newUserName,
                       java.lang.String newPassword,
                       java.lang.String newDescription)
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Updates the information stored for a user.
        Parameters:
        userID - ID of the user to be updated.
        newUserID - New user ID.
        newUserName - New user name.
        newPassword - New password.
        newDescription - New description.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgUserNotFoundException
        MgException - with code MgDuplicateUserException
        MgException - with code MgInvalidPasswordException

      • deleteUsers

        public void deleteUsers(MgStringCollection users)
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Deletes a set of users from the server. Prior to deletion, all of the users' group memberships are revoked.
        Parameters:
        users - IDs of the users to be deleted.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgUserNotFoundException

      • grantRoleMembershipsToUsers

        public void grantRoleMembershipsToUsers(MgStringCollection roles,
                                        MgStringCollection users)
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Grants the specified roles to the specified users.
        Parameters:
        roles - List of roles to grant to the specified users.
        users - IDs of users to receive the specified roles.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgUserNotFoundException
        MgException - with code MgRoleNotFoundException

      • revokeRoleMembershipsFromUsers

        public void revokeRoleMembershipsFromUsers(MgStringCollection roles,
                                           MgStringCollection users)
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Revokes the specified roles from the specified users.
        Parameters:
        roles - List of roles to revoke from the specified users. Repository.
        users - IDs of users to lose the specified roles.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgUserNotFoundException
        MgException - with code MgRoleNotFoundException

      • grantGroupMembershipsToUsers

        public void grantGroupMembershipsToUsers(MgStringCollection groups,
                                         MgStringCollection users)
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Grants membership in the specified groups to the specified users.
        Parameters:
        groups - Groups to receive the specified users.
        users - IDs of users to gain membership in the specified groups.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgUserNotFoundException
        MgException - with code MgGroupNotFoundException

      • revokeGroupMembershipsFromUsers

        public void revokeGroupMembershipsFromUsers(MgStringCollection groups,
                                            MgStringCollection users)
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Revokes membership in the specified groups from the specified users.
        Parameters:
        groups - Groups to lose the specified users.
        users - IDs of users to lose membership in the specified groups.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgUserNotFoundException
        MgException - with code MgGroupNotFoundException

      • enumerateGroups

        public MgByteReader enumerateGroups(java.lang.String user,
                                    java.lang.String role)
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Gets a list of available groups. Parameters specify the contents of the list:
        • If both user and role are NOT specified, return a list of all available groups.
        • If user is specified, return a list of groups of which that user is a member.
        • If role is specified, return a list of groups in that role.
        • If both user and role are specified, throw exception.
        Parameters:
        user - ID of user, if returning a list of groups owning a particular user; empty, otherwise.
        role - Role, if returning a list of groups with a particular role; empty, otherwise.
        Returns:
        Result containing the appropriate list of groups.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgUserNotFoundException
        MgException - with code MgRoleNotFoundException

        Parameters:
        group - Name of the new group.
        description - Description of the new group.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgDuplicateGroupException

      • deleteGroups

        public void deleteGroups(MgStringCollection groups)
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Deletes a set of groups from the server. All users owned by the groups will have their membership revoked prior to deletion of the groups.
        Parameters:
        groups - Names of the groups to be deleted.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgGroupNotFoundException

      • grantRoleMembershipsToGroups

        public void grantRoleMembershipsToGroups(MgStringCollection roles,
                                         MgStringCollection groups)
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Grants the specified role memberships to the specified groups.
        Parameters:
        roles - List of roles to be granted to the specified groups.
        groups - Groups to receive the specified roles.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgGroupNotFoundException
        MgException - with code MgRoleNotFoundException

      • revokeRoleMembershipsFromGroups

        public void revokeRoleMembershipsFromGroups(MgStringCollection roles,
                                            MgStringCollection groups)
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Revokes the specified roles from the specified groups.
        Parameters:
        roles - Roles to be revoked from the groups.
        groups - Groups to lose the specified roles.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgGroupNotFoundException
        MgException - with code MgRoleNotFoundException

      • enumerateRoles

        public MgStringCollection enumerateRoles(java.lang.String user,
                                         java.lang.String group)
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Gets a list of available roles. Parameters specify contents of the list:
        • If both user and group are NOT specified, return a list of all available roles.
        • If group is specified, return a list of roles for that group.
        • If user is specified, return a list of roles for that user.
        • If both user and group are specified, throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        user - ID of user, if returning list of roles for a particular user; empty, otherwise.
        group - Name of group, if returning list of roles for a particular group; empty, otherwise.
        Returns:
        Result containing the appropriate list of roles.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgGroupNotFoundException
        MgException - with code MgUserNotFoundException

      • enumerateServers

        public MgByteReader enumerateServers()
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Return an XML document describing the server on the site.
        Returns:
        XML document describing the list of servers.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException

      • addServer

        public void addServer(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String description,
                      java.lang.String address)
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Add server to the site.
        Parameters:
        name - Server name. May be the same as the server DNS name.
        description - Server long description. May indicate the server's intended use.
        address - Server IP address or DNS name.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgServerAlreadyExistsException
        MgException - with code MgInvalidServerAddressException

      • updateServer

        public void updateServer(java.lang.String oldName,
                         java.lang.String newName,
                         java.lang.String newDescription,
                         java.lang.String newAddress)
        (NOTE: This API is not officially supported and may be subject to removal in a future release without warning. Use with caution.) Update server information for the site.
        Parameters:
        oldName - Current server name.
        newName - New server name.
        newDescription - New long description.
        newAddress - New server IP address or DNS name.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgConnectionNotOpenException
        MgException - with code MgServerNotFoundException
        MgException - with code MgServerAlreadyExistsException
        MgException - with code MgInvalidServerAddressException

        Throws:
